element.name: Castletown House by Lotsafish, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)

description.b: This is the Third in a series of four caches looking at the historical sites surrounding Castletown Estate.

p.i: All Caches contain FTF Certificates as the FTF reward.

element.long-description:
Castletown House
Castletown House, Celbridge, County Kildare, Ireland's finest Palladian country house, is an imposing building built in 1722 for William Conolly, the Speaker of the Irish House of Commons. It formed the centrepiece of a 550 acre estate. Sold to developers in 1965, the estate is now divided between State and private ownership, with the house and 120 acres in Government care, and part of the lands now occupied by a modern housing estate. The Cache: Start at N53 20.932, W006 31.816 Look around and count the number of full pillars surrounding the house? Answer = A N53 21.(A+481) , W006 31.(A+656)
The cache is a medium size loc-box wrapped in a black covering.
element.additional-waypoints:
CP26EVY - Car Park
N 53째 21.122 W 006째 31.668
Parking Area

ul.li:
2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by Mullingar Man
second find of the day, TFTC!

2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by Soupcooler
Really enjoyed the walk around the grounds! House is magnificant! TFTC!

2010-05-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Found on a lovely evening walk. Hadn't been here in many years, it's still as impressive. Good hint. TFTC In TB #352

2010-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by culann
Nice easy fine TFTC

2010-05-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by garrethmolloy
Great walk, easy find.

Castletown House

Castletown House, Celbridge, County Kildare, Ireland's finest Palladian country house, is an imposing building built in 1722 for William Conolly, the Speaker of the Irish House of Commons. It formed the centrepiece of a 550 acre estate. Sold to developers in 1965, the estate is now divided between State and private ownership, with the house and 120 acres in Government care, and part of the lands now occupied by a modern housing estate.

The Cache: Start at N53 20.932, W006 31.816 Look around and count the number of full pillars surrounding the house? Answer = A N53 21.(A+481) , W006 31.(A+656)

The cache is a medium size loc-box wrapped in a black covering.
